text.listBibl:
References
[1]S. W. Hawking, " Particle creation by black holes, " Communica-
tions in Mathematical Physics, vol. 43, no. 3, pp. 199–220, 1975.
[2] J. D. Bekenstein, " Black holes and entropy, " Physical Review D,
vol. 7, no. 8, pp. 2333–2346, 1973.
[3] J. M. Bardeen, B. Carter, and S. W. Hawking, " The four laws
of black hole mechanics, " Communications in Mathematical
Physics, vol. 31, pp. 161–170, 1973.
[4] T. Jacobson, " Thermodynamics of spacetime: the Einstein
equation of state, " Physical Review Letters, vol. 75, p. 1260, 1995.
[5] T. Padmanabhan, " Classical and quantum thermodynamics of
horizons in spherically symmetric spacetimes, " Classical and
Quantum Gravity, vol. 19, no. 21, pp. 5387–5408, 2002.
[6] C. Eling, R. Guedens, and T. Jacobson, " Nonequilibrium ther-
modynamics of spacetime, " Physical Review Letters, vol. 96, no.
12, Article ID 121301, 2006.
[7] C. Eling, " Hydrodynamics of spacetime and vacuum viscosity, "
Journal of High Energy Physics, vol. 11, article 048, 2008.
[8] G. Wang and W.-B. Liu, " Nonequilibrium thermodynamics of
dark energy on cosmic apparent horizon, " Communications in
Theoretical Physics, vol. 52, no. 2, pp. 383–384, 2009.
[9] S. Chakraborty and A. Biswas, " Universe bounded by apparent
horizon: an irreversible thermodynamic prescription, " Astro-
physics and Space Science, vol. 343, no. 1, pp. 395–399, 2013.
[10] S. Chakraborty and A. Biswas, " Universe bounded by event
horizon: a non equilibrium thermodynamic prescription, "
Astrophysics and Space Science, vol. 343, no. 2, pp. 791–794, 2013.
[11] K. Karami, M. Jamil, and N. Sahraei, " Irreversible thermo-
dynamics of dark energy on the entropy-corrected apparent
horizon, " Physica Scripta, vol. 82, no. 4, Article ID 045901, 2010.
[12] R. Maartens, " Causal thermodynamics in relativity, " http://arxiv
.org/abs/astro-ph/9609119.
[13] W. Zimdahl, " Cosmological particle production, causal ther-
modynamics, and inflationary expansion, " Physical Review D,
vol. 61, Article ID 083511, 2000.
[14] W. Zimdahl, " Bulk viscous cosmology, " Physical Review D, vol.
53, no. 10, pp. 5483–5493, 1996.
[15] B. Wang, Y. G. Gong, and E. Abdalla, " Thermodynamics of
an accelerated expanding universe, " Physical Review D, vol. 74,
Article ID 083520, 2006.
[16] M. Li, " A model of holographic dark energy, " Physics Letters B,
vol. 603, no. 1-2, pp. 1–5, 2004.
[17] N. Mazumder and S. Chakraborty, " Validity of the generalized
second law of thermodynamics of the universe bounded by
the event horizon in holographic dark energy model, " General

[18] A. G. Cohen, D. B. Kaplan, and A. E. Nelson, " Effective field

[19] B. Wang, Y. G. Gong, and E. Abdalla, " Transition of the dark

energy model, " Physics Letters B, vol. 624, no. 3-4, pp. 141–146,
2005.
[20] P. A. R. Ade, N. Aghanim, M. I. R. Alves et al., " Planck
2013 results. I. Overview of products and scientific results, "

[21] M. Li, X. D. Li, Y. Z. Ma, X. Zhang, and Z. Zhang, " Planck
constraints on holographic dark energy, " Journal of Cosmology

[22] A. G. Riess, L. Macri, S. Casertano et al., " A 3% solution:

telescope and wide field camera 3, " The Astrophysical Journal,
vol. 730, p. 119, 2011.
[23] J. Guy, M. Sullivan, A. Conley et al., " The Supernova Legacy
Survey 3-year sample: type Ia supernovae photometric distances

102, 2011.

[26] J. Guy, P. Astier, S. Baumont et al., " SALT2: using distant
